issues.message: [Stack trace information](1) flows to this location and may be exposed to an external user.

rule.name: py/stack-trace-exposure
rule.full_description: Leaking information about an exception, such as messages and stack traces, to an external user can expose implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.

issues.message: [Stack trace information](1) flows to this location and may be exposed to an external user.

rule.name: py/stack-trace-exposure
rule.full_description: Leaking information about an exception, such as messages and stack traces, to an external user can expose implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.

issues.message: The full URL of this request depends on a [user-provided value](1).

rule.name: py/full-ssrf
rule.full_description: Making a network request to a URL that is fully user-controlled allows for request forgery attacks.

issues.message: Unsafe deserialization depends on a [user-provided value](1).

rule.name: py/unsafe-deserialization
rule.full_description: Deserializing user-controlled data may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code.

issues.message: This regular expression depends on a [user-provided value](1) and is executed by [re.finditer](2).

rule.name: py/regex-injection
rule.full_description: User input should not be used in regular expressions without first being escaped, otherwise a malicious user may be able to inject an expression that could require exponential time on certain inputs.

issues.message: This path depends on a [user-provided value](1).

rule.name: py/path-injection
rule.short_description: Uncontrolled data used in path expression
rule.full_description: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.

issues.message: This log entry depends on a [user-provided value](1).

rule.name: py/log-injection
rule.full_description: Building log entries from user-controlled data is vulnerable to insertion of forged log entries by a malicious user.

issues.message: This string concatenation which depends on [library input](1) is later used in a [shell command](2).

rule.name: py/shell-command-constructed-from-input
rule.short_description: Unsafe shell command constructed from library input
rule.full_description: Using externally controlled strings in a command line may allow a malicious user to change the meaning of the command.
